workout_title: Biceps Peak and Back Definition Workout

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds in each direction.
Interlace fingers behind your back, lift arms, and open chest while leaning slightly forward. Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cow) and rounding it (cat). Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.

exercises.setup: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward.
execution: 1. Stand facing away from the cable machine with the handle in each hand.
2. Step forward to create tension in the cable, keeping your elbows slightly behind your body.
3. Curl the handles towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on keeping your elbows stationary to maximize tension on the biceps.

exercises.setup: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm.
execution: 1. Sit on the preacher bench with your upper arms resting on the pad.
2. Hold the barbell or dumbbells with an underhand grip.
3. Curl the weight towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms on the pad.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure full range of motion by going all the way down and maintaining high tension in the stretched position.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
2. Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
4. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on pulling with your back muscles rather than your arms to maximize back engagement.

exercises.setup: Use a chest-supported row machine or incline bench.
execution: 1. Lie face down on the bench with your chest supported.
2. Hold the handles or dumbbells with a neutral grip.
3. Pull the weight towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your back muscles at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your chest firmly against the pad to isolate your back muscles effectively.
